column2: their cocktail and ice program are excellent. You can really see the European influence with all the lillet and other spirits used. I had a Lillet rose martini
column3: an old fashioned and a paper plane. For the heck of it I actually bought a coors banquet. Small beer selection of decent offerings mixed with crap domestic. It's actually not so bad after having eaten and drank such rich
column4: dense and opulent flavors to cleanse the pallet a bit. I was happy to see red breast and the 16 yo laga available. I wasn't a fan of the stirred cocktail charge of $2. They use crystal clear cocktail ice which I've got down to a science at home and knowing how much extra work it is
column5: makes you appreciate the added enhancement it adds to cocktails.
